p: Emetine ( 2) is an alkaloid that possesses a monoterpenoid-tetrahydroisoquinoline skeleton. Emetine occurs in three plant families, including Alangiaceae, Icacinaceae, and Rubiaceae, and the major source of emetine is Psychotria ipecacuanha Stokes (Rubiaceae). Emetine is an anti-HIV agent that blocks HIV-1 infection in primary and established cells at noncytotoxic levels and its effects are mediated by reverse transcription inhibition. Emetine also blocked HIV-1 infection of a variant strain harboring an NRTI-resistance mutation. 30 The isoquinoline alkaloids laurolitsine (norboldine, 3) isolated from the family Lauraceae belong to the aporphinic group, which contain only one benzyl tetrahydroisoquinoline group. Laurolitsine showed a significant inhibitory effect on HIV-1 integrase with an IC 50 value of 16.3 mM. 31, 32
